turn.8: Constraints on English phonotactics include:   Segments of a syllable are universally distributed following what is called the Sonority Sequencing Principle (SSP), which states that, in any syllable, the nucleus has maximal sonority and that sonority decreases as you move away from the nucleus.
turn.10: Sonority is a measure of the amplitude of a speech sound.
turn.11: Is there any other interesting information?
turn.12: The particular ranking of each speech sound by sonority, called the sonority hierarchy , is language-specific, but, in its broad lines, hardly varies from a language to another, which means all languages form their syllables in approximately the same way with regards to sonority.
